DOC.brief_summary: The goal study determine effect coach-led neuromuscular warm-up non-contact , low extremity ( LE ) injury rate among female athlete predominantly non-white public high school system . The investigator hypothesize warm-up would reduce non-contact LE injury .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Neuromuscular Warm-up Injuries Female Athletes
DOC.detailed_description: We recruit basketball soccer coach athletes Chicago public high school . We randomize team intervention control group . We train intervention coach implement 20-minute neuromuscular warm-up track training cost . Control coach use usual warm-up . All coach report weekly athlete exposure ( AEs ) injuries result miss practice/game . Research assistants interview injured athlete . We compare injury rate control intervention group .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria High School Students ( initial part study complete ) play basketball soccer Chicago public high school team coach basketball soccer Chicago public high school team female , age 1420 Inclusion Criteria coach ( current part study ) 1 . Willing implement new warmup team 's practice game 2 . Willing complete pre postseason survey use warmup program one season ( survey attach ) . 3 . Willing complete pre postworkshop test workshop ( test attach ) . 4 . Willing allow study personnel observe implementation warmup three team practice game . Exclusion Criteria coach ( current part study ) There separate exclusion criterion coach .
